column5: Hello everyone, My name is Mike. I have been lurking around here for a while and figured it was time to start posting. Im 25 years old but have been steelheading since is was about 10 or so. Just wanted to say hello.
Hey Mike !!! Welcome to the board.Theres lots of steelheaders in here to share with.Never fished them, but from what i have seen, it must be an awesome experience
Welcome aboard Mike, from another Mike  Mike

Oh, great. Another elitest named Mike.... Next thing we know he is going to be posting rod and reel balanced perfectly on shoulders type pics of the INCREDIBLE fish that he has wrangled to the shore after a perfect float presentation of a roe bag or whatever happens to be the bait of choice that paticular day and then we are going to have to half-heartedly congratulate him on SUCH a stellar catch while we try to swallow the drool of envy that is coursing down our throats...OH I could go on but...DARN IT! No-one ever takes me steelheading, it's a conspiricy I tell you!                      Oh, BTW welcome to the board!

Welcome to the board!  Did we mention we love pictures???  Just don't give gps locations, show pictures with a blade of grass or rock that is clearly identifiable on a riverbank and you are golden!!! LOL  What areas do you like to fish?  (no trib names...but eastern GTA, Lake Huron Tribs etc is fine).  As we head into the fall steelhead season, I look forward to your reports!

I live in Mississauga so you can guess where I frequent most often, other then that I try to get up to the Bruce peninsula as much as possible. I so rarely take photos because when fish solo I prefer to not mess around to much trying to take a picture.
. WHAT EVER YOU DO DON'T TALK ABOUT FOOD ON HERE . THATS MY JOB ....LOL , WELCOME THERE NEW MIKE .
Welcome aboard! If you need any advice about any kind of fishing...just ask me! I'm the senior expert here!  You've come to the right place to share and ask! The people here are the best!

Welcome aboard to the board!  From one steelheader to another, the more (non-descript) pictures, the better!  People are always seeking float fishing advice and it's great that we have such an evolving base of experts.  Cheers!

hello Mike, welcome! Wheres your location? Even though I've never fished for steelhead or salmon I've been reading lots of post, storing great information and will hopefully try it someday. I'm a bass guy myself, but pike and pickeral are welcome!
Hi Mike, welcome to the board.
